flawed_nl_solution:
Johnny spends 6/3=2 hours walking the 6 dogs who have 60-minute walks.
He makes $20*6=$<<20*6=210>>210 for these walks.
Thus, he has 4-2=2 hours=120 minutes left to walk the other dogs.
He can walk 3*(120/30)=<<3*(120/30)=12>>12 dogs in this time.
Thus, he will make $15*12=$<<12*15=180>>180 on these walks.
In total per day, he makes $210+$180=$<<210+180=390>>390 per day.
Thus, during the week, he makes $390*5=$<<390*5=1950>>1950.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 120, not 210. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
